member.name: T:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher
member.summary: This class includes an array of ClientHandlers according to the number of elevators connected, and coordinates their activity, including assigning each order to the right elevator

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates order dispatcher. Orders from log will be read in and served if 'recoverng' is true

member.name: P:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher.ElevatorCount
member.summary: Number of the elevators connected to the dispatcher

member.name: P:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher.LocalAddress
member.summary: Local IP-address of the dispatcher

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher.Run
member.summary: Listens on the local port 55555 for connections and creates new ClientHandler's appropriately

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stop listening for new connections

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.OrderDispatcher.DispatchOrder(Elev.Formats.Order)
member.summary: Chooses the right elevator for the order. Throws NullReferenceException if no elevators available, but never returns null
member.returns: The elevator that should receive this order

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.StatusReceivedEventArgs.#ctor(Elev.Formats.State,System.Collections.Generic.List{Elev.Formats.Order})
member.param: List of unserved orders to be copied

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary: Creates a ClientHandler that will use the given socket

member.name: P:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.UnservedOrders
member.summary: Copy of the list of unserved orders

member.name: P:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.Status
member.summary: The elevators last known status. Throws InvalidOperationException if not received yet or if EmergencyStop'ed

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.Run
member.summary: Receives data from the elevator and processes it asynchronously

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.Stop
member.summary: Closes the tcp-connection with the elevator

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.SendOrderAsync(Elev.Formats.Order)
member.summary: Send a received order to the elevator, so that it will be able to react appropriately (button lights etc)

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.SendServedAsync(Elev.Formats.Order)
member.summary: Send a served order to the elevator, so that it will be able to react appropriately (button lights etc)

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.ClientHandler.SendToServeAsync(Elev.Formats.Order)
member.summary: Send an order that should be served by this elevator

member.name: P:Elev.Dispatcher.ProcessDiedEventArgs.IsPrimary
member.summary: True if the process that has died, was primary

member.name: T:Elev.Dispatcher.IProcessNotifier
member.summary: Process pair notifier. Maintains a tcp connection with a pair process on the same computer and notifies user when the connection is lost.

member.name: E:Elev.Dispatcher.IProcessNotifier.ProcessDied
member.summary: Fired when connection with the pair process is lost

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.IProcessNotifier.Start
member.summary: Connects with the second proccess, and monitors the connection. Runs asynchronously. Stops and closes socket if the connection is lost

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.IProcessNotifier.Stop
member.summary: Breaks connection with the pair process, nothrow

member.name: T:Elev.Dispatcher.PrimaryProcessNotifier
member.summary: Starts backup process and maintains connection with it. Fires an event when the connection is lost or unable to connect

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.PrimaryProcessNotifier.Start
member.summary: Starts backup-process. Stops when the connection fails. Should be started again when PairDied is triggered

member.name: T:Elev.Dispatcher.BackupProcessNotifier
member.summary: Connects to the primary process which is assumed to be already running Fires an event when the connection is lost (or if unable to connect)

member.name: M:Elev.Dispatcher.BackupProcessNotifier.Start
member.summary: Connects to primary.
